analysis.raw_analysis:
1. TRANSFORMATION TYPE: Input and output are same size (14x14), ratio 1:1.

2. PATTERN: In every example the large connected region of color 8 (the top shape) is preserved in position and shape but recolored uniformly; the small connected region of color 1 is removed (turned to 0).

3. KEY CHANGES:
- Ex1: 8-region kept, 8 -> 7; 1-region removed (to 0).
- Ex2: 8-region kept, 8 -> 3; 1-region removed.
- Ex3: 8-region kept, 8 -> 2; 1-region removed.
- Ex4: 8-region kept, 8 -> 3; 1-region removed.
- Ex5: 8-region kept, 8 -> 2; 1-region removed.

=== INPUT-INPUT COMPARISONS ===
All inputs: 14x14, background 0. Each has one large connected region color 8 in the upper area and one small connected region color 1 lower. Shapes/positions vary but 8 is the single largest component and 1 is a small separate object.

=== OUTPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
Every output: only the large region remains (same shape & coords) recolored (7/3/2 vary); all color-1 pixels are gone; rest 0.

=== INPUT-OUTPUT COMPARISONS ===
Rule: delete all color-1 objects; recolor every pixel of the original color-8 connected component to a single new nonzero color while keeping its shape and position.

Reference objects: The large connected color-8 region (always in the upper area) stays fixed in shape/position and is the transformation target — it determines what is changed.

Grid pattern: For every example, recolor the entire large 8-connected component to a single new color; background stays 0 and the small 1-object is removed.

Objects: Two recurring objects — the big complex color-8 region (primary, preserved shape but recolored) and the small color-1 cluster (secondary, erased).

=== GENERAL RULE ===
Find the large connected region that is colored 8 and leave its shape and position unchanged, but recolor every cell of that connected 8-component to a single new color (a single nonzero color chosen for that object; the exact replacement color may vary between tasks). Remove all small connected regions colored 1 by turning those cells to 0 (background). Leave the background (0) and any other pixels not part of those two object types unchanged.

comparison_sections.input_input: All inputs: 14x14, background 0. Each has one large connected region color 8 in the upper area and one small connected region color 1 lower. Shapes/positions vary but 8 is the single largest component and 1 is a small separate object.
comparison_sections.output_output: Every output: only the large region remains (same shape & coords) recolored (7/3/2 vary); all color-1 pixels are gone; rest 0.
comparison_sections.input_output: Rule: delete all color-1 objects; recolor every pixel of the original color-8 connected component to a single new nonzero color while keeping its shape and position.

general_steps.instruction: Step 1: For each connected object composed only of color 8, recolor every cell of that connected 8-component to a single uniform nonzero color (i.e. replace color 8 with one replacement color used for that component in the output).
general_steps.condition: objects that are connected components composed only of color 8

general_steps.instruction: Step 2: For each connected object composed only of color 1, change every cell to color 0 (remove that small object by mapping color 1 to the background color 0).
general_steps.condition: objects that are connected components composed only of color 1
